Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
Fix: Make IPFS and Arweave data source creation mutually exclusive

Changes:
- identity-registry.ts: Changed sequential if statements to else if for IPFS/Arweave handling
- reputation-registry.ts: Same mutually exclusive pattern for feedback URIs

Problem:
- Previously, both IPFS and Arweave data sources could be triggered for the same URI
- This could cause indexing conflicts and incorrect URIType storage

Solution:
- Use else if to ensure only ONE data source is created per URI
- Add clarifying comments about mutual exclusivity
- Applies to both agent registration and feedback submission flows

Testing:
- Deploy to local graph-node on Ubuntu server for verification
- Test ar:// URI indexing with agent registration
- Test ar:// URI indexing with feedback submission
EOF
)")

Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
Fix: Update Arweave integration for ESM compatibility

After merging main, updated all Arweave-related files to use .js extensions
in imports (required for ESM module resolution in v0.31).

Changes:
- src/core/sdk.ts: Added arweave config to SDKConfig interface, arweaveClient property and getter
- src/core/feedback-manager.ts: Added arweaveClient parameter to constructor  
- src/core/arweave-client.ts: Updated all imports to use .js extensions
- src/utils/arweave-tags.ts: Updated all imports to use .js extensions
- src/utils/registration-format.ts: Updated imports to use .js extensions
- src/core/sdk.ts: Pass arweaveClient to FeedbackManager constructor
- package-lock.json: Regenerated after npm install

All TypeScript compilation errors resolved. Build passing.
